thread.title: NHL roundup: Babcock gets first Leafs win
thread.title_full: NHL roundup: Babcock gets first Leafs win

author: The Associated Press
title: NHL roundup: Babcock gets first Leafs win
text:
COLUMBUS, Ohio — Leo Komarov scored two late goals and Toronto beat the Columbus Blue Jackets 6-3 on Friday night to give Mike Babcock his first victory as coach of the Maple Leafs. 
Joffrey Lupul had a goal and an assist to help Toronto improve to 1-2-1. 
Scott Hartnell had a goal and an assist for Columbus to reach 600 career points. The Blue Jackets are 0-5-0, extending the worst start in franchise history. 
SHARKS 2, DEVILS 1: Joe Pavelski and Brent Burns scored in the shootout and San Jose rode another big effort by Martin Jones – 31 saves – in a victory at winless New Jersey. 
HURRICANES 5, RED WINGS 3: Jordan Staal and Kris Versteeg each had a goal and two assists and Carolina handed host Detroit its first loss. 
JETS 3, FLAMES 1: Dustin Byfuglien scored the tiebreaker with 1:28 remaining, and Winnipeg won at home. 
NOTES 
SHARKS: Center Logan Couture will miss four to six weeks after breaking his right leg during practice. 
LIGHTNING: Defenseman Nikita Nesterov was suspended two games for boarding the Stars’ Curtis McKenzie on Thursday. Share
